pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [ ] depends on: #17582

This is the part of #16646 (or #16486) that is not resolved by https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/5376.

#16486 causes a significant slowdown in category theory, I'm not sure what the difference is compared to https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/5376, but maybe it's because of `outParam`.

This PR is a variant of #17410 that does not use `outParam`. Instead, it uses `set_option synthInstance.checkSynthOrder false in` to turn off lean's complaint about synthesization order.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [914becb041](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17411/commits/914becb04103bb9a18cf7db4b5390d2d54a79618)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instance (priority := 100) DistribMulAction.toDistribSMul`
`- instance (priority := 100) DistribMulAction.toDistribSMul : DistribSMul M A`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d748718e-d584-44d4-8d5e-4f512ff14b29) for commit 2018982d5b1ea4b5cafc0e22f1ac4be8c5322b6b.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/66374161-6382-45fa-872c-f671c11487ce/to/d748718e-d584-44d4-8d5e-4f512ff14b29) against commit 5ddd0ae2d57a887d36d8c99db785285cbf154439:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                               Metric         Change
  =============================================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.ChangeOfRings                       instructions    -4.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LocalizedModule                                 instructions    -9.1%
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.TrivSqZeroExt                                          instructions   -20.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.NonUnital   instructions    -4.8%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.FormalMultilinearSeries                      instructions   -12.0%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Function                                       instructions   -19.1%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Mul                                            instructions   -17.0%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Distribution.SchwartzSpace                            instructions    -6.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Algebra.TrivSqZeroExt                          instructions   -18.5%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.BallAction                                instructions   -19.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.Seminorm                                              instructions   -10.6%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.BilinearMap                                      instructions   -23.4%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.SesquilinearForm                          instructions   -10.0%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.QuadraticForm.Basic                              instructions    -5.8%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Tower                              instructions   -26.9%
+ ~Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Group.FundamentalDomain                          instructions   -12.3%
+ ~Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.Bochner                                 instructions    -9.3%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.IsTensorProduct                                     instructions   -15.4%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.Basic                                       instructions    -4.2%
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Module.Basic                                  instructions    -8.9%
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Module.FiniteDimension                        instructions   -10.7%
```

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17582~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3ffaa15c-9c9d-48a0-bd96-83f9b396ffb3) for commit 914becb04103bb9a18cf7db4b5390d2d54a79618.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/b2a9d461-f382-4b4b-abab-d995d1f9e5df/to/3ffaa15c-9c9d-48a0-bd96-83f9b396ffb3) against commit 9ba2d95ba478bcccea37c7f1f84932d364d9b314:
```diff
  Benchmark                                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.BallAction         instructions   -19.2%
+ ~Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Group.FundamentalDomain   instructions   -25.0%
```

I think we don't have a sufficiently good understanding of why this works, and how to turn this into a general rule for the entire library. Hence I'm hesitant to merge this.

I'm excited by the speedups that you discover. But they appear a bit like wizardry to me.
In order to keep the library maintainable, we should aim to find rules and guidelines that we can apply in general.

So I will close this PR, but with the clear signal that I would be very happy to have it reopened if you can show what general principles will allow others to find and maintain these kind of tweaks to the library.

pullRequest.title: perf: use implicit parameters in `SMul` hierarchy

source.title: Improving the performance of typeclass inference
[Merged by Bors] - perf: use implicit parameters in `SMul` hierarchy
